when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、助けてくれて！ (arigatou, tasukete kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, o-genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to bid farewell, often in formal settings.
example: さようなら、また明日！ (sayounara, mata ashita!) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used to apologize or to get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree to something.
example: はい、わかりました。 (hai, wakarimashita) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to deny or reject something politely.
example: いいえ、大丈夫です。 (iie, daijoubu desu) - No, it's okay.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a companion or close acquaintance.
example: 彼は私の友達です。 (kare wa watashi no tomodachi desu) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to one's home or a building where people live.
example: 私の家はここです。 (watashi no ie wa koko desu) - My house is here.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water for drinking or general use.
example: 水をください。 (mizu o kudasai) - Please give me water.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of consuming food.
example: 私は寿司を食べるのが好きです。 (watashi wa sushi o taberu no ga suki desu) - I like eating sushi.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of reading books, magazines, or any text.
example: 彼は毎朝新聞を読む。 (kare wa mai asa shinbun o yomu) - He reads the newspaper every morning.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of writing letters, notes, or documents.
example: 私は日記を書くのが好きです。 (watashi wa nikki o kaku no ga suki desu) - I like writing in my diary.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the domestic animal 'cat.'
example: 私の猫はとてもかわいいです。 (watashi no neko wa totemo kawaii desu) - My cat is very cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the domestic animal 'dog.'
example: その犬はとても賢い。 (sono inu wa totemo kashikoi) - That dog is very smart.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an educational institution.
example: 私の妹は学校に通っています。 (watashi no imouto wa gakkou ni kayotteimasu) - My younger sister goes to school.

word: ありがとうございません
when_to_say: Used in formal or polite situations to express gratitude.
example: 先生、ありがとうございました。 (sensei, arigatou gozaimashita) - Teacher, thank you very much.
